question.body: At the 0.05 significance level, how high does the number of marijuana users in the sample need to be for there to be enough evidence to reject H0 and conclude that indeed p > 0.157? Answer the same question for a significance level of 0.01. How do your answers to this question compare with your intuitive answer to question 1?

part.explanation: This table provides the answer. A random sample of size 100 with 22 marijuana users would be enough evidence to reject H0 at the 0.05 significance level. In order to be able to reject H0 at the more conservative 0.01 significance level, a random sample of size 100 with 25 (or more) marijuana users is needed.
